intro: Sacoila lanceolata f. luteoalba, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sacoila, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, such as tropical forests. Its foliage is often variegated, with a mix of green and white tones, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
